intro: Boca serrata, commonly known as the serrated mouth plant, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its serrated leaf margins and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found near water sources. The name "boca serrata" translates to "serrated mouth," referring to the distinctive shape of its leaves.
